review_blob: I had it in a bottle.  It was very light, lighter than I would expect a porter.  If I wanted a dark beer for hot weather, this would be my pick.  My porters Id prefer more robust.
Bold, complex, not as floral as I hoped for but very nice.   On tap at hotel Oregon.

About five years ago I thought that TG IPA was undrinkable, but  I started to appreciate more hoppy beers lately, so I gave it another try.  It came out from a tap as pale, hazy, with white foam on top.  It does taste bitter, without much floral overtones, mostly bitter and slightly herbal.  It has medium body, and it finishes bitter, but its easy to drink.

Had on tap at Drift Inn after soaring over St. Perpetua Trail in the light rain.
